result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 10-17-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Credit for 2 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Consecutive to: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher C Scott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court COMMENDED Defendant for his compliance with the DPA as of this hearing.  Defense advised that Defendant still needs to complete TWO (2) HOURS of Community Service.  Defense will provide documentation of FORTY-THREE (43) of FORTY-FIVE (45) HOURS of completed Community Service.  

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the State,  court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED and READ-IN for the purposes of Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:

On motion of the state,  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve TWO (2) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TWO (2) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 10-17-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has completed FORTY of FORTY-FIVE (40/45) HOURS of Community Service.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that the facility at which he conducted Community Service has the proof of Community Service.  Defendant advised that he will have ALL the Community Service done by the next date.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for final Review.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court commended Defendant for compliance thus far.  Defendant has completed TWENTY-ONE (21) HOURS of Community Service.  Defendant to complete a further THREE (3) HOURS of Community Service.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for final Review.  Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Fokus Family Service progress report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant advised that Defendant has completed TWENTY (20) HOURS of Community Service as of this date.  State did not have their file.  State moved to adjourn for a period of SIXTY (60) DAYS.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Fokus Family Service progress report.  Filed, sdg.
Letter from Fokus Family Services received and filed.

Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  No gun/drug order signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Randy Sitzberger for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Bond continued as previously set.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher C Scott in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/6/16 @ 1:30pm
